content.description:
5 bolt route up the pillar facing Not So Cool dome, look for a high first bolt above a grainy 4th class chimney. Work your way up the chimney, the climbing isn't at grade, but some of the features are suspect.  After clipping the first bolt, weave your way through interesting climbing to the rappel equipped anchor.   Some may want a supplemental piece between bolts 3 and 4.

While not a destination route, this is a worthy additional to your day on your way up or down from Hidden Dome. Due to rock quality and bolt spacing, one should be solid at 5.9+ for the lead.

While lowering/rapping, care should be taken as to not known some of the loose features on your ground team.
content.location: This is on the wall that appears to be Hidden Dome from the approach.  It is just uphill from Cool Dome on the right.  The belay is under a large set of boulders.

climbs.name: Clamming at the Beach
climbs.fa: Tom Addison and Scott Pond, March 1987

content.description: This is a fairly nice fist crack in a remote location.
content.location: This is an obvious fist crack near the right end of the wall.
